measured_by: Center for Epidemiologic Studies Depression Scale (CESD)
justification: "The CESD is a 20-item, self-report scale designed to assess the presence and severity of depressive symptoms over the past week."
"The self-referent encoding task (SRET) is often used to measure self-referent processing."

measured_by: Drift rate parameter from diffusion model applied to SRET
justification: "Applied to the current study, drift rate provides a measure of the ease by which participants categorize each word as self-referential or non-self-referential. Drift rate can thereby be conceptualized as a measure of schema strength."

measured_by: Number of negative self-referent adjectives recalled on SRET
justification: "Past research with the SRET has used the number of negative self-referent adjectives recalled as a proxy for negative self-schema."

"Potential participants were screened via telephone using the Mini International Neuropsychiatric Interview (MINI), which screened for 17 different Axis I Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders-IV (DSM-IV) disorders."
